title: (x) Citibank - Interstate, OCRK Square (customized) {Randy, Yves}
content:
Could someone clue me in to what typefaces are used in these attachments? I'm working on a spec video piece for Citi and need to replicate their logo and end tag. Thanks!   
   
 ![type&logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33532.jpg) ![type](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33533.jpg)

 [‹ Mercedes Benz typeface for model designations](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4316 "Go to previous forum topic") [Nike team Mexico football shirt ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4312 "Go to next forum topic")
author: abstracttruth

comments.content:
I think citi is a custom version of interstate. Their banking centers use customized insterstate for everything.   
   
I think the monospaced campaign font is also custom.   
   
Randy

The campaign broke in 2000 from Fallon after they won the account.   
   
At any rate [Interstate](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=1082002431673390&fontname=Interstate) is the place to start.   
Or even [faster](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019/http:/web.brandsoftheworld.com/?id=112&action=1&text=citi).   
   
Randy

The Citibank font is a custom version of Joe Kral's 1996   
 [OCRK Bold Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214011019/http:/www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/ocrk.html) from Test Pilot Collective.
Thanks for the leads . . . I thought they might be customized.
The OCR has been here before. Use search before posting!
I do admit we need a better search.

We should take it as a compliment that it's faster to post and wait for a reply than it is to search.   
Either that, or the search needs serious fixing :-)
